isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - OIL PAN INSTALLATION - On engines with S/N 593721 and Above.

svcproc.title: On engines with S/N 593721 and Above.

step1.para: Scrape or wire brush all of the old liquid gasket from the pan rail, flywheel housing, front cover and oil pan. Use a commercially available brake cleaner to remove all oil and solvent from these surfaces.

Apply a 6.3 mm (0.25 in.) bead of R.T.V. sealant (P/N 446 839 C1) to the mating areas of the front cover to pan rail and pan rail to flywheel housing as shown in Figure 7.86
.

note.para: DO NOT APPLY EXCESSIVE AMOUNTS OF R.T.V. WHICH COULD END UP IN THE PICKUP SCREEN, RESTRICTING LUBE OIL FLOW.

step1.para: Using guide studs, install the oil pan gasket and oil pan onto the crankcase within 10 minutes of R.T.V. application.

Install the four cover spacers (if applied) and tighten the oil pan bolts and washers to the specified special torque. Also, tighten the four longer bolts and washers at the rear of the oil pan to the specified torque. Refer to Figure 7.87
.
Install the oil pan drain plug, using a new plastic seal washer. Tighten to the specified special torque.
Install the vibration damper as follows:

step2.para: Heat the damper in water. Do not exceed 100° C (212° F) when heating the damper and install the damper when cold (room temperature).

Align the keyway on the damper with the key on the crankshaft. Use bolts which are longer than the damper retainer bolts to draw the damper onto the crankshaft. Remove the long bolts and install the damper retainer using the correct bolts.

Prevent the crankshaft from turning and tighten the bolts to the specified special torque. Refer to Figure 7.88
.
